alfredsnippet.snippet:
"Every line of scientific pursuit has its fascinations, but electrical investigation appears to possess a peculiar attraction, for there is no experiment or observation of any kind in the domain of this wonderful science which would not forcibly appeal to us.  Yet to me it seems, that of all the many marvellous things we observe, a vacuum tube, excited by an electric impulse from a distant source, bursting forth out of the darkness and illuminating the room with its beautiful light, is as lovely a phenomenon as can greet our eyes."

- Nikola Tesla, On Light And Other High Frequency Phenomena
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Nikola Tesla on Vacuum Tubes
